result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

103    Defendant Mikhael Cabrera Plaza in court.  Attorney Brett A Ekes in court for Mikhael Cabrera Plaza.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over. DE requests substitution of Br 6; Br 1 assigned.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Order

1:24 PM
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brett Ekes. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Status Conference adjourned to 11/3/22 at 100pm. Arraignment. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Probably cause found . Bound over to Br. 6. Bond continued as previously set. DE motion to modify bond. Arguments heard. Court denies motion. ec
Arraignment on November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
